.  It is highly forested and sparsely populated and is like Vermont as it was in 1950.  Here is the best chance for hearing an authentic Vermont accent.

value: NEK Border with Canada - including Derby Line

runs north to south through the Kingdom, connecting with other major roadways throughout

that serve the region include Burlington, VT; Montreal; Manchester, NH; Boston and Albany. The Kingdom has three state airports: Caledonia County State Airport in Lyndonville; Newport State Airport in Newport/Coventry and John H. Boylan State Airport in Island Pond.  All welcome light private and business aircraft.
A car is a must for getting around the Northeast Kingdom, but many of the town centers are compact enough to be explored on foot.

value: content=The Northeast Kingdom has some of the most spectacular foliage in Vermont.

With so many trails and mountains, hiking is a must when visiting the Northeast Kingdom.

Jay Peak is the northernmost ski area in Vermont and is popular with Canadians and locals.  It has recently undergone a huge expansion adding two new hotels, a golf course, spa, hockey rink, and indoor water park.

Owned by the same company as Jay Peak the Burke Mountain ski area is minutes away from the Kingdom's major towns and offers skiing for any level of skier or rider. It has been announced that the mountain is also in next few years is going to go through a major expansion involving three hotels and many more recreational facilities. Currently, on the upper level of the base lodge the Tamarack Grill operates serving food and drink to the public. The mountain also offers a disount pass for a combined season pass with Jay Peak.
4850 Route 242, Jay 802-327-2323. Farm to table restaurant located at Jay Peak Resort.
